notes.text:
An update for webkit2gtk3 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
WebKitGTK is the port of the portable web rendering engine WebKit to the GTK platform.

Security Fix(es):

* webkitgtk: Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing (CVE-2024-40866)

* webkitgtk: A malicious website may exfiltrate data cross-origin (CVE-2024-44187)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash (CVE-2024-44185)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash (CVE-2024-44244)

* webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may prevent Content Security Policy from being enforced (CVE-2024-44296)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKit. This flaw allows a remote attacker to conduct spoofing attacks by exploiting an inconsistent user interface issue. The attacker could perform address bar spoofing by tricking a victim into visiting a specially crafted website.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: Visiting a malicious website may lead to address bar spoofing

cwe.name: Access of Memory Location After End of Buffer

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKitGTK, where processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to the program crashing. Code execution is not discarded as a consequence.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is rated as important severity because it allows maliciously crafted web content to crash the application, potentially leads to denial of service. While it does not compromise confidentiality or integrity, the ability to crash the program without requiring authentication poses a significant risk.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: webkitgtk: webkit2gtk: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected process crash

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKit. This flaw allows a remote attacker to exfiltrate data cross-origin by convincing a victim to visit a specially crafted website, which results in obtaining sensitive information.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in WebKitGTK, where processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to program to a crash. This issue occurs because code execution is not discarded as consequence.

cwe.name: Improperly Implemented Security Check for Standard

notes.text: A flaw was found in WebKitGTK. Processing maliciously crafted web content may prevent the Content Security Policy from being enforced. This issue leads to items that were banned from running to be executed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
